questions.question: Which of the following is listed as an essential element of Nigeria’s airworthiness regulatory system in the DAWS PPM?
options: Registration of aircraft
Issuance of pilot licences
Operation of air traffic control towers
Airport terminal management
questions.correctAnswer: Registration of aircraft
questions.hint: This is about keeping an official list of aircraft.
questions.funFact: The PPM explicitly lists registration of aircraft as a core element of the airworthiness regulatory system.

questions.question: Who within NCAA/DAWS is cited as the authorised person to approve amendments to the DAWS PPM?
options: Director-General of Civil Aviation
Director, Airworthiness Standards (DAWS)
Head of Technical Library
General Manager, AOC Certification & Surveillance
questions.correctAnswer: Director, Airworthiness Standards (DAWS)
questions.hint: This authority is kept within the directorate rather than external offices.
questions.funFact: The manual states the Director of Airworthiness Standards is the only person who can authorise PPM amendments.

questions.question: Which document does the PPM list as the primary technical guidance for Airworthiness Inspectors?
options: Technical Guidance Manual Vol. IV - Airworthiness Inspector's Handbook
ICAO Annex 11 - Air Traffic Services
NCAA Catering Standards Manual
Nigeria Airport Operations Code
questions.correctAnswer: Technical Guidance Manual Vol. IV - Airworthiness Inspector's Handbook
questions.hint: It’s an inspector-focused technical guidance volume.
questions.funFact: DAWS refers inspectors to its Technical Guidance Manuals for standardised inspection procedures and checklists.

questions.question: When determining whether an aircraft is 'airworthy', the PPM states two basic conditions. One is conformity to type design. What is the other?
options: It must be in a condition for safe operation (no critical deterioration)
It must be less than 20 years old
It must have the manufacturer's approval for each flight
It must be operated only by licensed pilots
questions.correctAnswer: It must be in a condition for safe operation (no critical deterioration)
questions.hint: Think condition: wear, corrosion, leaks — not age.
questions.funFact: DAWS clarifies that 'airworthy' means conformity to type design and being in a safe operational condition.

questions.question: Which of the following duties is included in DAWS responsibilities related to Certificates of Airworthiness?
options: Issuance and renewal of Certificates of Airworthiness and related surveys
Issuance of pilot licences for private pilots
Management of airport landing fees
Supervision of in-flight catering
questions.correctAnswer: Issuance and renewal of Certificates of Airworthiness and related surveys
questions.hint: DAWS handles the airworthiness certificate lifecycle.
questions.funFact: The manual lists issue/renewal and surveying aircraft for Certificates of Airworthiness as primary DAWS duties.

questions.question: What is TFCC/Registry primarily responsible for in DAWS file handling?
options: Safe custody of files and keeping a register of file movements
Issuing airworthiness directives
Authorising flight crew rosters
Granting fuel purchase approvals
questions.correctAnswer: Safe custody of files and keeping a register of file movements
questions.hint: Think central file custody and tracking.
questions.funFact: TFCC/Registry maintains file movement registers and is responsible for opening certain official files.

questions.question: According to the PPM, which files may only be opened by the TFCC/Registry?
options: Operator files, AOC/AMO files and Special Purpose/Project files
Personal training logs of ASIs
Public relations press releases
Vendor invoices for cafeteria supplies
questions.correctAnswer: Operator files, AOC/AMO files and Special Purpose/Project files
questions.hint: These are official technical files that require controlled opening.
questions.funFact: The PPM restricts opening of operator, AOC/AMO and project files to TFCC/Registry staff to maintain traceability.

questions.question: What is the normal return time to TFCC for files taken by ASIs after action, as per the PPM?
options: 5 working days
24 hours
30 calendar days
Unlimited until supervisor asks
questions.correctAnswer: 5 working days
questions.hint: A short timeframe to keep files circulating.
questions.funFact: Files taken for action should normally be returned within five working days to ensure availability and traceability.

questions.question: When a file becomes bulky (over approximately 100 folios), TFCC must:
options: Close the file and open a new volume
Compress it into a single PDF and email it
Permanently archive it without indexing
Send it to the Director-General for permission
questions.correctAnswer: Close the file and open a new volume
questions.hint: Think physical file volume management.
questions.funFact: Large files are closed and a new volume is opened to maintain manageable file sets.

questions.question: During file dispatch between regional offices and headquarters, the PPM requires:
options: Proper bagging, addressing and a recorded receipt of dispatch
Only an email notification without physical packaging
Sending files by commercial courier without records
No formal record keeping to speed up process
questions.correctAnswer: Proper bagging, addressing and a recorded receipt of dispatch
questions.hint: The manual emphasises traceability on transit.
questions.funFact: Files must be bagged and receipts recorded to ensure custody and accountability during transfers.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of Mandatory Occurrence Reporting (MOR) referenced in the PPM?
options: Safety reporting and incident analysis
Scheduling staff leave
Allocating office supplies
Promoting social events
questions.correctAnswer: Safety reporting and incident analysis
questions.hint: It supports safety deficiency and incident analysis programmes.
questions.funFact: MORs feed into the Safety Deficiency and Incident Analysis programme under the State Safety Programme.

questions.question: If a recurring defect trend is detected, DAWS should establish or use which system to capture and analyze these occurrences?
options: Service Difficulty Reporting (SDR) system
Public feedback forum
Annual staff party log
Cafeteria suggestion box
questions.correctAnswer: Service Difficulty Reporting (SDR) system
questions.hint: SDR collects defect and service difficulty data for trend analysis.
questions.funFact: DAWS recommends SDRs and defect trend analysis to detect and correct airworthiness issues.

questions.question: If an aircraft is suspected of being unairworthy, the PPM directs that the aircraft should be:
options: Regarded as unairworthy and withdrawn from service pending inspection and corrective action
Allowed to fly until proven otherwise
Grounded permanently without inspection
Sold to another operator immediately
questions.correctAnswer: Regarded as unairworthy and withdrawn from service pending inspection and corrective action
questions.hint: Safety-first approach; revoke CofA until rectified.
questions.funFact: Suspected unairworthy aircraft must be withdrawn from service and have the CofA revoked until corrected.

questions.question: Which DAWS activity is used to determine national applicability of foreign airworthiness directives and actions required?
options: Reviewing foreign ADs/SBs and directing corrective action where national aircraft are affected
Automatically adopting all foreign directives without review
Publishing them on social media only
Delegating them to commercial vendors
questions.correctAnswer: Reviewing foreign ADs/SBs and directing corrective action where national aircraft are affected
questions.hint: This is a risk assessment and applicability decision process.
questions.funFact: DAWS reviews foreign service bulletins and airworthiness directives to decide national applicability and corrective measures.

questions.question: What formal action may DAWS publish if an inspection reveals a mandatory safety corrective item affecting the fleet?
options: An Airworthiness Directive directed to all operators
A marketing bulletin to promote maintenance shops
A general newsletter with no mandatory requirement
A permission slip for voluntary repairs
questions.correctAnswer: An Airworthiness Directive directed to all operators
questions.hint: Mandatory corrective items require a formal directed action.
questions.funFact: When mandatory corrective action is identified, DAWS can issue an airworthiness directive for compliance.

questions.question: Which DAWS group handles the initial issue and surveillance of Approved Maintenance Organisations (AMOs)?
options: Approved Maintenance Organisation Certification & Surveillance (AMOC&S)
Public Relations Division
Commercial Operations Department
Airport Facilities Unit
questions.correctAnswer: Approved Maintenance Organisation Certification & Surveillance (AMOC&S)
questions.hint: AMOC&S is named for AMO certification and surveillance.
questions.funFact: AMOC&S is responsible for AMO issuance, periodic surveillance, and approval of maintenance manuals.

questions.question: Under AMOC&S responsibilities the PPM explicitly lists oversight of which of the following?
options: Inspection of aviation fuelling facilities and fuel farms
Retail concessions at airports
In-flight entertainment contracts
Airport ground transport timetables
questions.correctAnswer: Inspection of aviation fuelling facilities and fuel farms
questions.hint: Fuel handling safety is an airworthiness surveillance activity.
questions.funFact: AMOC&S includes inspection of fuel farms and aviation fuelling equipment among its duties.

questions.question: Which approval does DAWS provide related to continuing airworthiness for operators?
options: Approval of Continuing Airworthiness Management Exposition (CAME) and CAMO activities
Approval of in-flight catering menus
Approval of parking fee schedules
Approval of airport advertising plans
questions.correctAnswer: Approval of Continuing Airworthiness Management Exposition (CAME) and CAMO activities
questions.hint: CAME and CAMO relate to continuing airworthiness management.
questions.funFact: DAWS reviews and approves operators' CAME and CAMO submissions for continued airworthiness oversight.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes DAWS' approach when a foreign manufacturer's service bulletin may affect national aircraft?
options: Assess applicability, then decide on national directive or other corrective actions
Ignore foreign bulletins completely
Force immediate grounding of all aircraft of that type without assessment
Delegate the decision to airport management
questions.correctAnswer: Assess applicability, then decide on national directive or other corrective actions
questions.hint: DAWS analyzes relevance before issuing national measures.
questions.funFact: DAWS monitors service bulletins and, where applicable, directs corrective action or issues an AD.

questions.question: When compliance and enforcement is required after an inspection, the PPM indicates DAWS should:
options: Proceed with compliance and enforcement procedures in line with the Nig.CARs and sanctions schedule
Release a public apology and take no enforcement action
Arrange a media campaign against the operator
Transfer the issue to an unrelated ministry
questions.correctAnswer: Proceed with compliance and enforcement procedures in line with the Nig.CARs and sanctions schedule
questions.hint: Enforcement follows established legal/regulatory steps.
questions.funFact: DAWS coordinates compliance and enforcement actions and may impose sanctions per national regulations.

questions.question: Which baseline qualification is acceptable for appointment as an Airworthiness Aviation Safety Inspector (ASI)?
options: An experienced licensed maintenance engineer with approximately five years of practical experience
A customer service certificate
A high school diploma only
A license to operate airport buses
questions.correctAnswer: An experienced licensed maintenance engineer with approximately five years of practical experience
questions.hint: Technical maintenance experience of about five years is a key eligibility route.
questions.funFact: The PPM allows experienced licensed maintenance engineers (≈5 years) or engineering graduates with training to become inspectors.

questions.question: What must be included in an ASI's training folder according to the PPM?
options: Copy of NCAA ID, credentials, CV, licences and training records
A list of favourite aircraft liveries
Receipts for personal expenses
Holiday photographs
questions.correctAnswer: Copy of NCAA ID, credentials, CV, licences and training records
questions.hint: Professional credentials and training history are mandatory components.
questions.funFact: Training folders are comprehensive records containing credentials, CVs and OJT progress charts.

questions.question: If an inspector is asked for an interpretation of regulation outside their expertise, the PPM advises the inspector to:
options: Require a written request so it can be coordinated with DAWS and Legal
Provide an immediate public interpretation over the radio
Post their interpretation on social media
Ignore the request
questions.correctAnswer: Require a written request so it can be coordinated with DAWS and Legal
questions.hint: Regulatory interpretations needing cross-checks must be coordinated centrally.
questions.funFact: The PPM recommends that complex regulatory interpretations be coordinated with DAWS and the Legal Department.

questions.question: Which combination best matches the PPM’s expectations of an ASI’s professional attributes?
options: Impartiality, tact, integrity and a high degree of technical competence
Celebrity status, social media following and marketing skills
No formal training, but optimistic attitude
Only managerial experience with no technical background
questions.correctAnswer: Impartiality, tact, integrity and a high degree of technical competence
questions.hint: Inspectors are expected to combine technical skill with high integrity and tact.
questions.funFact: The manual emphasises both technical qualifications and personal qualities like impartiality and tact.

questions.question: Which training requirement does the PPM state for inspectors before they are authorised to conduct airworthiness oversight independently?
options: Completion of prescribed On-the-Job Training (OJT) as per the ITS until competent in the task
A single online multiple-choice test with no practical training
Only an oral assurance to a supervisor
A short briefing with no recorded evidence
questions.correctAnswer: Completion of prescribed On-the-Job Training (OJT) as per the ITS until competent in the task
questions.hint: OJT and demonstrated competence are required before independent authorisation.
questions.funFact: Inspectors must complete OJT per ITS and demonstrate competence before acting independently.

questions.question: Before a regional audit, teams are expected to prepare by reviewing which materials?
options: Latest technical manuals and recent DAWS reports
Local touristic guides
Catering menus only
Airline in-flight magazines
questions.correctAnswer: Latest technical manuals and recent DAWS reports
questions.hint: Audit prep focuses on technical references and past reports.
questions.funFact: Audit teams must gather updated technical manuals and prior monthly reports before departure.

questions.question: What is the Principal Airworthiness Inspector (PAI) role as described in the PPM?
options: Lead inspector and primary point of contact for a given operator or AMO
Cafeteria manager for the regional office
Public relations officer for maintenance organisations
External contractor with no oversight duties
questions.correctAnswer: Lead inspector and primary point of contact for a given operator or AMO
questions.hint: PAI leads surveillance and is the focal inspector for assigned operators.
questions.funFact: PAIs coordinate surveillance and approval activities on behalf of DAWS for assigned operators and AMOs.

questions.question: During a regional audit, auditors should verify presence and currency of which operator documents?
options: Copies of AMO procedures manuals, MCM, C of A records and maintenance control documents
Employee personal shopping lists
Local weather blogs
Airport tourism brochures
questions.correctAnswer: Copies of AMO procedures manuals, MCM, C of A records and maintenance control documents
questions.hint: Audits check mini-libraries and operator control documents for currency and completeness.
questions.funFact: Auditors review operators' maintenance manuals and proof of certificate currency during surveillance.

questions.question: When preparing the team list for an audit, what operational detail is essential according to the PPM?
options: List of aircraft types in the operator's fleet and expected documents to audit
Preferred hotels and restaurants only
Team members' favourite sports
List of employees for social media follow-up
questions.correctAnswer: List of aircraft types in the operator's fleet and expected documents to audit
questions.hint: Knowing the fleet and documents helps scope inspections properly.
questions.funFact: Teams must note fleet composition and expected documents to ensure the right expertise is assigned.

questions.question: How often must HODAWS in regions forward updates (e.g., C of A status, inspection findings) to corporate HQ?
options: Quarterly (every 3 months)
Annually
Only during emergencies
Every day
questions.correctAnswer: Quarterly (every 3 months)
questions.hint: Periodic, scheduled updates rather than continuous daily uploads.
questions.funFact: The manual requires regional offices to send quarterly updates on aircraft files to HQ.

questions.question: Which DAWS area is responsible for certification and surveillance of RPAS (drones) from an airworthiness viewpoint?
options: Aircraft Certification and Continuing Airworthiness (ACCA)
Catering Division
Passenger Services
Airport Marketing
questions.correctAnswer: Aircraft Certification and Continuing Airworthiness (ACCA)
questions.hint: ACCA covers certification and continuing airworthiness tasks including RPAS aspects.
questions.funFact: DAWS delegates RPAS (airworthiness) certification and ROC-related surveillance to ACCA.

questions.question: Which practice supports traceability of aircraft parts as required by DAWS?
options: Maintaining part provenance records and monitoring service bulletins
Using anonymous supply chains with no records
Discarding old paperwork monthly
Posting part details on social media
questions.correctAnswer: Maintaining part provenance records and monitoring service bulletins
questions.hint: Traceability and monitoring helps ensure parts are legitimate and compliant.
questions.funFact: DAWS emphasises part traceability and monitoring of service bulletins to protect structural integrity.

questions.question: If a mandatory safety corrective item affects a type in the national fleet, the PPM indicates DAWS may issue:
options: An Airworthiness Directive directed to all operators of the affected type
A general industry newsletter with optional guidance
A routine marketing flyer about maintenance
A local bulletin only for the operator's immediate staff
questions.correctAnswer: An Airworthiness Directive directed to all operators of the affected type
questions.hint: Mandatory corrective actions become formal, directed instruments.
questions.funFact: Airworthiness Directives impose mandatory compliance for corrective actions across affected operators.

questions.question: When reviewing foreign Airworthiness Directives and Service Bulletins for national action, DAWS must:
options: Assess applicability to national registered aircraft and direct corrective measures where necessary
Immediately adopt every foreign directive without analysis
Ignore foreign guidance because it's irrelevant to national operations
Outsource the decision to unrelated third parties
questions.correctAnswer: Assess applicability to national registered aircraft and direct corrective measures where necessary
questions.hint: Decision requires analysis of national applicability.
questions.funFact: DAWS evaluates foreign ADs/SBs and decides on national applicability and corrective action to maintain safety.

questions.question: Which course of action best reflects the PPM when an inspector discovers evidence suggesting deliberate maintenance fraud or unapproved parts?
options: Inform supervisor, preserve evidence and initiate enforcement/compliance investigation as per Nig.CARs
Fix it quietly and do not record it anywhere
Immediately terminate the operator without due process
Post allegations on public forums
questions.correctAnswer: Inform supervisor, preserve evidence and initiate enforcement/compliance investigation as per Nig.CARs
questions.hint: Serious breaches require evidence preservation and formal enforcement steps.
questions.funFact: The PPM instructs inspectors to notify supervisors and follow enforcement procedures when encountering serious regulatory contraventions.

questions.question: What should an ASI include in their monthly Record of Activities according to the PPM?
options: How their time was used and tasks performed (minimum 40 hrs/week)
Their favourite restaurants
Personal expense receipts
Holiday playlist
questions.correctAnswer: How their time was used and tasks performed (minimum 40 hrs/week)
questions.hint: Records must be professional and reflect workload.
questions.funFact: ASIs must submit monthly records detailing activity and time usage; the PPM specifies a minimum of 40 hours per week.

questions.question: Who is authorised to sign off major correspondence that demands financial commitment from applicants/operators?
options: Director, Airworthiness Standards or Director-General when required
Any junior ASI
Cafeteria manager
External vendor representative
questions.correctAnswer: Director, Airworthiness Standards or Director-General when required
questions.hint: Signatures for financial commitments are escalated to leadership.
questions.funFact: The PPM requires financial commitment letters to be signed by senior management to ensure accountability.

questions.question: What is the recommended content of an executive summary for technical assignments sent to DAWS?
options: Findings and recommendations with references to detailed reports kept in the technical file
All raw measurement data without commentary
Irrelevant personal opinions about the operator
A short thank-you note only
questions.correctAnswer: Findings and recommendations with references to detailed reports kept in the technical file
questions.hint: Summaries highlight findings and refer to detailed files for evidence.
questions.funFact: Executive summaries should focus on findings and recommendations while technical details remain in corresponding files.

questions.question: If a staff member needs to deviate substantially from a prescribed PPM procedure, the staff member must:
options: Notify the Director, DAWS as soon as possible and provide full details/justification
Implement the deviation and notify colleagues later informally
Ignore formal procedure and proceed without documentation
Announce the change publicly without approval
questions.correctAnswer: Notify the Director, DAWS as soon as possible and provide full details/justification
questions.hint: Major deviations require formal notification and rationale.
questions.funFact: The PPM requires formal notification to DAWS leadership with reasons for any substantial deviations from procedure.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the PPM's process for project work that exceeds routine task allocations?
options: Open a project control sheet, allocate chargeable time and record costs for invoicing upon completion
Proceed without records and bill informally
Outsource the entire project without oversight
Record the work only in personal notes
questions.correctAnswer: Open a project control sheet, allocate chargeable time and record costs for invoicing upon completion
questions.hint: Projects must be tracked on control sheets and charged appropriately.
questions.funFact: Standard project procedure includes opening a project control sheet and recording time and costs for proper invoicing.
